meanings.definition: Capable of being owned or possessed.
meanings.sent1: The toy was ownable, so the child happily played with it.
meanings.sent2: The house was ownable, and the family decided to buy it.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the fishbowl looked ownable and tried to claim it as its own.
meanings.sent4: The old book had an ownable charm that made it a favorite among collectors.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new bike was so ownable that everyone in the neighborhood wanted to ride it.

meanings.sent1: The land was ownable, perfect for building a new house.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was ownable, and the collector added it to their collection.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy puppy looked so ownable that everyone wanted to adopt it.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful painting had an ownable quality that made it a valuable piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The rare coin was incredibly ownable, making it a prized possession for the numismatist.
